other_tests.findings: Evaluated the use of alcohol, smoking, and cocaine during pregnancy.
Tested for alcohol abuse; results not specified.
Normal baseline heart rate, presence of accelerations, absence of decelerations, no uterine contractions, and short-term variability >4.5 ms.
Persistent signs of reduced amniotic fluid and abnormal fetal Doppler indices.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initial AFI was 73 mm, decreased to 70 mm; umbilical artery PI increased from 96th to 98th percentile; middle cerebral artery PI and cerebroplacental ratio decreased in percentiles.

other_tests.findings: Administered betamethasone 12 mg intramuscularly, two doses 24 hours apart, to prevent neonatal respiratory distress syndrome.
